meanings.sent1: She is wiser than her younger sister.
meanings.sent2: The older students are wiser than the younger ones.
meanings.sent3: The owl felt wiser than the squirrel with its big round eyes.
meanings.sent4: His wrinkled face made him look wiser than his years.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tree seemed wiser than all the other plants in the forest.

meanings.definition: Showing good judgment or common sense.
meanings.sent1: It was wiser to wait for the storm to pass before going outside.
meanings.sent2: Making a budget is a wiser choice than spending all your money at once.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was wiser to nap during the day and play at night.
meanings.sent4: Choosing the scenic route turned out to be wiser than taking the highway.
meanings.sent5: Listening to her advice proved wiser than ignoring it.

meanings.sent1: The professor is wiser in the subject of history than the students.
meanings.sent2: Traveling to different countries makes you wiser about different cultures.
meanings.sent3: The old book looked wiser than all the new ones on the shelf.
meanings.sent4: His grandfather's stories made him feel wiser about life.
meanings.sent5: The wise old owl was wiser than any other bird in the forest.
